sentence.Network_en: For some months the share price remained fairly static.
sentence.Network_cn: 有那么几个月，股票价格一直非常地稳定。

sentence.Network_en: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.

sentence.Network_en: Built-up static contributes to sick building syndrome.
sentence.Network_cn: 高楼林立中的静电干扰是引发大楼病综合征的原因之一。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting the science of weight and its effects): via modern Latin from Greek statikē (tekhnē) 'science of weighing'; the adjective from modern Latin staticus, from Greek statikos 'causing to stand', from the verb histanai. Sense 1 of the adjective dates from the mid 19th cent

encyclopedia.content: 像在VB，C，C++，Java中我们可以看到static作为关键字和函数出现，在其他的高级计算机语言如FORTRAN、ALGOL、COBOL、BASIC、LISP、SNOBOL、PL/1、Pascal、PROLOG、Ada等语言中也是有出现的，只是有着不同的作用，对于其具体作用，读者有需要的时候是可以具体查阅的鉴于时间问题今天我就不一一罗列了。

entry.def: Something that is static does not move or change.

example.ex: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased...
example.tran: 获得资格证的年轻人数量一直维持不变或出现下降。

example.ex: Both your pictures are of static subjects.
example.tran: 你的两张照片拍的都是静止物体。

entry.def: Static or static electricity is electricity which can be caused by things rubbing against each other and which collects on things such as your body or metal objects.

entry.tran: (广播、电视里的)静电噪声，静电干扰
entry.def: If there is static on the radio or television, you hear a series of loud noises which spoils the sound.

means.word_mean: 1. a crackling or hissing noise cause by electrical interference

sentences.sentence: "they will probably give you a lot of static about your editorial"
"a static village community and a completely undynamic type of agriculture"
"the inertia of an object at rest"

means.word_mean: 3. concerned with or producing or caused by static electricity;

sentences.sentence: "an electrostatic generator produces high-voltage static electricity"

jushi.english: Some people get static electricity in their hair.

jushi.english: Even with static population, consumption rose steeply.
